wikipedia_page.main: Christopher Wayne Ralston (born  (1944-05-25) 25 May 1944) is a former England international rugby union player. He represented the British and Irish Lions on their 1974 tour to South Africa and at the time played club rugby for Richmond F.C..

link_mentions.page: 1974 British Lions tour to South Africa
1972 England rugby union tour of South Africa
1973 England rugby union tour of Fiji and New Zealand
1972–73 New Zealand rugby union tour of Britain, Ireland, France and North America
List of England national rugby union players

response: The Middlesex tour party consisted of 70 members though the minority of these were players, the majority were officials and non-playing members who were travelling as supporters. Amongst the players, at least three had previously toured East Africa; Patrick Orr (twice, with Anti-Assassins in 1965 and Richmond F. C. in 1963), Chris Ralston (with Richmond F. C. in 1963) and Brian Stoneman (twice, with Richmond F. C. and Combined (Oxford and Cambridge) Universities, both in 1963).
* Chris Ralston (Rosslyn Park F.C.,   and Lions)
